sen.j: 寄生地主制（きせいじぬしせい）は、田畑など農地の所有者である寄生地主（単に地主と略すこともある）が、小作人（こさくにん）と呼ばれる農民（小作農や単に小作と呼ばれることもある）に土地を貸し出して耕作させ、成果物である米やムギなどの農作物の一部を小作料（こさくりょう）と言う名の地代として徴収する制度。
sen.e: The parasitic landlord system was the system that allowed a parasitic landlord, the owner of a farmland, such as rice fields, vegetable fields, etc., to lend a farmland to the farmer called kosakunin (a tenant farmer) (also known as kosakuno [a tenant farmer] or kosaku [a tenant farmer]), cultivate the land, and take some farm products, such as rice, barley, etc., as the land rent called kosakuryo (farm rent).

The parasitic landlord system was the system that allowed a parasitic landlord, who owned farmlands such as rice fields, vegetable fields, etc., to lend a farmland to a farmer called kosakunin (a tenant farmer) (also known as kosakuno or kosaku), to have him cultivate the land, and to take away some farm products, such as rice, barley, etc., as the land rent called kosakuryo (farm rent).
sen.cmt: toを補うことによって文構造を明確にします。
sen.e: The parasitic landlord system was the system that allowed a parasitic landlord, who owned farmlands such as rice fields, vegetable fields, etc., to lend a farmland to a farmer called kosakunin (a tenant farmer) (also known as kosakuno or kosaku), to have him cultivate the land, and to take away some farm products, such as rice, barley, etc., as the land rent called kosakuryo (farm rent).

sen.j: 地主に小作料を支払って田畑を借りて営農することも小作と言った。
sen.e: Kosaku also referred to the farming which was practiced by renting a farmland, paying farm rent to a landlord.
Kosaku is also a name for farming which was practiced by renting a farmland and paying farm rent to a landlord.
sen.cmt: refer toの用法がやや不自然ですので変更します。
sen.e: Kosaku is also a name for farming which was practiced by renting a farmland and paying farm rent to a landlord.

sen.j: 寄生地主の多くは小作料に依存し、あたかも小作人に寄生するかのような印象を与えた。
sen.e: Since most parasitic landlords relied on their farm rents, they gave the impression that they were parasitic on their tenant farmers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since most parasitic landlords relied on their farm rents, they gave the impression that they were parasitic on their tenant farmers.
Since most parasitic landlords relied on their farm rents, they gave the impression that they were parasitic on their tenant farmers.

sen.j: その事から批判的意味も含めて寄生地主と言われるようになった。
sen.e: Due to this reason, they came to be called the parasitic landlords with the ironic intent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For this reason, they came to be ironically called parasitic landlords.
sen.cmt: reasonについては前置詞forの方が自然です。For ironic intentでは分かりにくいです。
sen.e: For this reason, they came to be ironically called parasitic landlords.

sen.j: もちろんどのような賃貸業でも所有者が賃貸料に依存するのは変わらない。
sen.e: Of course, in any lease business, an owner relies on the rent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Of course, in any lease business, an owner relies on the rent.
Of course, in any lease business, an owner relies on the rent.

sen.j: しかし小作料は高額なことが多く、農村内に豊かな寄生地主と貧しい小作人と言う貧富の差を生み出すことになった。
sen.e: However, the farm rent was often very expensive, which caused to create the gap between rich parasitic landlords and poor tenant farmers in a farm village.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the farm rent was often very expensive, which created the gap between rich parasitic landlords and poor tenant farmers in a farm village.
However, the farm rent was often very expensive, which created the gap between rich parasitic landlords and poor tenant farmers in a farm village.

sen.j: 農村内に住む在地地主とのほかに、都市など農村外に住む不在地主が存在した。
sen.e: In addition to the landlords who lived within a farm village, there were the landlords who lived outside a farm village, such as a city.
Some landlords lived within a farm village and other landlords lived outside a farm village, for example, in a city.
sen.cmt: there were構文は限定詞つきの名詞を主語にとりません。構文を変更します。
sen.e: Some landlords lived within a farm village and other landlords lived outside a farm village, for example, in a city.

sen.j: なお単に寄生地主制と言った場合は日本の制度を指す。
sen.e: When the system is simply called the parasitic landlord system, it refers to the system used in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term 'parasitic landlord system' used without the frills refers to the system in Japan.
sen.cmt: 「何も飾りをつけずに用いられた『寄生地主制』という語は日本の制度を指す」と言い換えて訳しました。
sen.e: The term 'parasitic landlord system' used without the frills refers to the system in Japan.

sen.j: 海外における類似の制度にはコロナートゥス（ローマ帝国）と言った別の呼称を利用される事がある。
sen.e: A different name, such as Colonatus (in the Roman Empire), is sometimes used to indicate the similar system existed in a foreign country.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A different name, such as Colonatus (in the Roman Empire), is sometimes used to indicate a similar system which existed in a foreign country.
sen.cmt: 関係詞がなければ文が成立しません。
sen.e: A different name, such as Colonatus (in the Roman Empire), is sometimes used to indicate a similar system which existed in a foreign country.

tit.j: 日本における寄生地主制の歴史
tit.e: The history of the parasitic landlord system in Japan
The history of the parasitic landlord system in Japan
The history of the parasitic landlord system in Japan

sen.j: 明治時代以前
sen.e: Before the Meiji Period
Before the Meiji Period
Before the Meiji Period

sen.j: 安土桃山時代に豊臣秀吉が行った太閤検地によって、農地の所有者は耕作する農民とされた。
sen.e: The land lord survey conducted by Taiko (the honorific title for a regent) Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Azuchi-Momoyama period decided that the owner of a farmland was the farmer who cultivated the land.

The nationwide land survey conducted by Taiko (the honorific title for a regent) Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Azuchi-Momoyama period decided that the owner of a farmland was the farmer who cultivated the land.
sen.cmt: 「太閤検地」の訳は用語集を参考にしてnationwide land surveyとします。
sen.e: The nationwide land survey conducted by Taiko (the honorific title for a regent) Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Azuchi-Momoyama period decided that the owner of a farmland was the farmer who cultivated the land.

sen.j: また1643年には江戸幕府によって農民間で田畑の売買を禁止する田畑永代売買禁止令が公布された。
sen.e: In 1643, the Edo bakufu issued the Denpata-eitai-baibai-kinshirei (the prohibition on the sale of arable lands) to prohibit the selling of the cultivated fields among farmers.
Furthermore, in 1643, the Edo bakufu issued the Denpata-eitai-baibai-kinshirei (the permanent prohibition on the sale of arable lands) to prohibit the sale of cultivated fields among farmers.
sen.cmt: 「また」「永代」を訳出します。特定の田畑ではないのでcultivated landに定冠詞はつけません。
sen.e: Furthermore, in 1643, the Edo bakufu issued the Denpata-eitai-baibai-kinshirei (the permanent prohibition on the sale of arable lands) to prohibit the sale of cultivated fields among farmers.

sen.j: これは富農が貧農から土地を買い集め、農村の社会制度が崩壊する事を恐れたためである。
sen.e: The prohibition was issued because the government was afraid that rich farmers bought lands from poor farmers, and which led to the collapse of the social system of a farm village.
The prohibition was issued because the government was afraid that rich farmers might buy lands from poor farmers and cause a collapse of the social system of a farm village.
The prohibition was issued because the government was afraid that rich farmers might buy lands from poor farmers and cause a collapse of the social system of a farm village.

sen.j: その後、貨幣経済の進展に伴って、次第に困窮する農民が出てきた。
sen.e: After that, as the monetary economy developed, the farmers who lived in poverty gradually increased.
After that, as the monetary economy developed, the number of farmers who lived in poverty gradually increased.
sen.cmt: 困窮する農民の「数が増えた」ということですのでnumberが必要です。
sen.e: After that, as the monetary economy developed, the number of farmers who lived in poverty gradually increased.

sen.j: 田畑永代売買禁止令では田畑の質入を禁止していなかったため、質流れと言う形で売買が行われた。
sen.e: Because the prohibition on the sale of the arable lands was not restricted to pawn the cultivated fields, the farmlands were bought and sold under foreclosure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the prohibition on the sale of the arable lands did not restrict pawnage of cultivated fields, farmlands were bought and sold under foreclosure.
sen.cmt: 元の訳だと「田畑永代売買禁止令は質入に限定されていなかった」の意となり、日本文と異なります。
sen.e: Because the prohibition on the sale of the arable lands did not restrict pawnage of cultivated fields, farmlands were bought and sold under foreclosure.

sen.j: 田畑永代売買禁止令は有名無実化していった。
sen.e: The prohibition on the sale of arable lands came to exist in name only.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The prohibition on the sale of arable lands was rendered ineffectual.
sen.cmt: 「有名無実化」は「実効性を失った」と言い換えます。
sen.e: The prohibition on the sale of arable lands was rendered ineffectual.

sen.j: （参考）酒田本間氏
sen.e: (Reference) The Sakatahonma family.
(Reference) The Sakatahonma family.
(Reference) The Sakatahonma family.

sen.j: 明治時代から第二次世界大戦以前
sen.e: From the Meiji period to before the World War Ⅱ
From the Meiji period to a period before the World War Ⅱ
sen.cmt: to beforeと前置詞を重ねるのは不適です。
sen.e: From the Meiji period to a period before the World War Ⅱ

sen.j: 明治時代に行われた地租改正と、田畑永代売買禁止令の廃止により寄生地主制が進展した。
sen.e: Owing to Chiso-kaisei (the Land Tax Reform) implemented in the Meiji period and the abolition of the prohibition on the sale of arable lands, the parasitic landlord system was developed.
Owing to Chiso-kaisei (the Land Tax Reform) implemented in the Meiji period and the abolition of the prohibition on the sale of arable lands, the parasitic landlord system was developed.
Owing to Chiso-kaisei (the Land Tax Reform) implemented in the Meiji period and the abolition of the prohibition on the sale of arable lands, the parasitic landlord system was developed.

sen.j: 地租改正により土地所有者は金銭によって税金を払う義務が課せられることになった。
sen.e: When the Land Tax Reform was carried out, the duty to pay the tax in cash was imposed upon landlords.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result of the Land Tax Reform, the duty to pay the tax in cash was imposed upon landowners.
sen.cmt: 「地租改正を行った時」だけ税金の支払義務が課されたわけではありません。
sen.e: As a result of the Land Tax Reform, the duty to pay the tax in cash was imposed upon landowners.

sen.j: しかし、貧しい農民には重い負担であり裕福な者に土地を売り渡し小作人になっていった。
sen.e: However, since the tax was a heavy burden for poor farmers, they became tenant farmers, selling their lands to rich people.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, since the tax was a heavy burden for poor farmers, they became tenant farmers, selling their lands to rich people.
However, since the tax was a heavy burden for poor farmers, they became tenant farmers, selling their lands to rich people.

sen.j: 寄生地主の中には質屋などの金融業を兼業した。
sen.e: Some parasitic landlords had a side business as a moneylender such as a pawnshop.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some parasitic landlords had a side business as a moneylender such as a pawnshop.
Some parasitic landlords had a side business as a moneylender such as a pawnshop.

sen.j: 小作人を中心に金銭の貸付を行っていたものも少なくなかった。
sen.e: Not a few landlords lent money mainly to tenant farmers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Not a few landlords lent money mainly to tenant farmers.
Not a few landlords lent money mainly to tenant farmers.

sen.j: これにより、農村内での貧富の差は一層拡大された。
sen.e: This helped to increase the gap between rich and poor further in a farm village.
This helped to increase the gap between rich and poor further in a farm village.
This helped to increase the gap between rich and poor further in a farm village.

sen.j: こうして獲得した富を商工業に投資し、近代的な資本家に転換していった者もいる。
sen.e: Some invested the earned money in trading and manufacturing and turned to a modern capitalist.
Some invested the earned money in trading and manufacturing and turned to a modern capitalist.
Some invested the earned money in trading and manufacturing and turned to a modern capitalist.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後
sen.e: After the World War Ⅱ
After the World War Ⅱ
After the World War Ⅱ

sen.j: 日本が太平洋戦争（第二次世界大戦）で敗戦し連合国の占領下に置かれた時に日本を統治した連合国軍最高司令官総司令部の最高司令官ダグラス・マッカーサーは、寄生地主が日本の軍国主義に加担したとして農地改革を行った。
sen.e: Douglas MACARTHUR, the Supreme Commander of the General Headquarters (GHQ) of the Allied Powers, who governed Japan while Japan was under the Allied occupation after Japan had lost the Pacific War (the World War Ⅱ), implemented land reform because he thought that the parasitic landlords supported Japanese militarism.

Douglas MACARTHUR, the Supreme Commander of the General Headquarters (GHQ) of the Allied Powers, who governed Japan while Japan was under the Allied occupation after Japan had lost the Pacific War (the World War Ⅱ), implemented a land reform because he thought that the parasitic landlords had supported Japanese militarism.
sen.cmt: 「加担した」のは農地改革を行う前ですので過去完了で表現します。
sen.e: Douglas MACARTHUR, the Supreme Commander of the General Headquarters (GHQ) of the Allied Powers, who governed Japan while Japan was under the Allied occupation after Japan had lost the Pacific War (the World War Ⅱ), implemented a land reform because he thought that the parasitic landlords had supported Japanese militarism.

sen.j: この改革により寄生地主が所有していた農地は非常に安価な価格で買い上げられ、小作人に安価な値段で売り渡された。
sen.e: Owing to the land reform, the farmlands owned by the parasitic landlords were bought at a very cheap price and then sold to the tenant farmers at a cheap price.
Owing to the land reform, farmlands owned by parasitic landlords were bought at a very cheap price and then sold to tenant farmers at a cheap price.
sen.cmt: 限定されていませんので定冠詞は不要です。
sen.e: Owing to the land reform, farmlands owned by parasitic landlords were bought at a very cheap price and then sold to tenant farmers at a cheap price.

sen.j: 山林などは例外として対象に含まれず、これを以て完全に解体されたわけではないとの見解もある。
sen.e: Because mountains and forests were exempted from the land reform, some think that the landlord system wasn't abolished completely.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some think that the landlord system wasn't abolished completely because mountains and forests were exempted from the land reform.
sen.cmt: ここでは内容的に主節が文の中心ですので、主節を先に持ってくる方が自然です。
sen.e: Some think that the landlord system wasn't abolished completely because mountains and forests were exempted from the land reform.

sen.j: しかし、林業経営が50年～100年といった長期間にわたり多額の投資（間伐など人工林の育成経費の支出）を行い収益を得る。
sen.e: However, in forestry, profits are realized by making heavy investment (the expenses of the planting of man-made forests such as the expenses of thinning) for long periods of fifty years ～ one hundred years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in forestry, profits are realized only by making heavy investment in planting of man-made forests, such as thinning, for a long time of fifty to one hundred years.
sen.cmt: 日本語の直訳として「経費」を訳出すると不自然になります。
sen.e: However, in forestry, profits are realized only by making heavy investment in planting of man-made forests, such as thinning, for a long time of fifty to one hundred years.

sen.j: その性格上、資本力を持つ地主が直接、企業的な経営を行っているものがほとんどであること。
sen.e: Owing to the nature of the business, the landlords with the capital strength directly run forestry business, bringing in business-like management.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Owing to the nature of the business, in most of the cases landlords with the financial power directly run forestry business, bringing in business-like management.
sen.cmt: 「…がほとんどである」を訳出します。
sen.e: Owing to the nature of the business, in most of the cases landlords with the financial power directly run forestry business, bringing in business-like management.

sen.j: また、1970年代以降の外国での有余った輸入材の増加に伴う木材価格の暴落により、採算に見合う山林の大部分が消滅した。
sen.e: Most of the mountains and forests which could be a profitable business have ceased because the sharp decline in the wood price due to the increase in the imported woods which remained in foreign countries after the 1970s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, most of the mountains and forests which could be profitable have disappeared because of the sharp decline in the wood price due to an increase of imported woods which abounded in foreign countries after the 1970s.
sen.cmt: 「また」を訳出します。「消滅した」の訳語としてceaseだけでは不十分です。「ありあまった」の訳としてremainでは不十分です。
sen.e: Furthermore, most of the mountains and forests which could be profitable have disappeared because of the sharp decline in the wood price due to an increase of imported woods which abounded in foreign countries after the 1970s.

sen.j: そのことなどから、現在は殆どの森林が形骸化しているとも言える。
sen.e: Due to the above reasons, it can be said that currently most mountains and forests have come to lost the fundamental nature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For above reasons, it can be said that currently most mountains and forests have lost the fundamental nature.
sen.cmt: reasonについては前置詞forの方が自然です。ここではcome toは不要です。
sen.e: For above reasons, it can be said that currently most mountains and forests have lost the fundamental nature.

sen.j: 沖縄県および鹿児島県奄美諸島などは、太平洋戦争終結以降アメリカ合衆国による沖縄統治となったため、農地改革が行われなかった。
sen.e: The land reform wasn't carried out in Okinawa Prefecture, Amami islands, Kagoshima Prefecture, etc., because after the Pacific War the United States governed Okinawa.
The land reform wasn't carried out in Okinawa Prefecture or in Amami islands, Kagoshima Prefecture, etc., because after the Pacific War the United States governed Okinawa.
sen.cmt: orを補うことによって文構造を整理し、沖縄県と鹿児島県奄美諸島との関係を明白にします。
sen.e: The land reform wasn't carried out in Okinawa Prefecture or in Amami islands, Kagoshima Prefecture, etc., because after the Pacific War the United States governed Okinawa.
